item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/05/07/scaling-wordpress/#comment-4042">Vernon Fowler</a>.
Newer versions of MySQL default to InnoDB now instead of MyISAM. This was long over due.
As far as bbPress and BuddyPress, use InnoDB unless you have a good and specific reason not to.

item.title: By: Vernon Fowler
item.dc:creator: Vernon Fowler
item.description:
On slide 15 you mention to "Use InnoDB, unless you have a good reason not to". Should the current / next version of WordPress specify this storage engine out of the box? Should plugins that create tables also specify this storage engine?
Currently I have a mix of mostly MyISAM and InnoDB for just a few tables that were created by a plugin. Do you have any recommendations for a bbPress and BuddyPress site in relation to database storage engines?
Thanks for your time.
